laboratory_examinations.findings: Elevated CRP at 11.8 mg/L (normal range 0.0-8.0 mg/L); subsequent test showed CRP elevated at 50.4 mg/L.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: CRP increased from 11.8 mg/L to 50.4 mg/L.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Presence of heterozygous mutation in the FLCN gene with pathogenic variant c.779+1G>T.
Showed small lung cysts, calcified granulomas, and noncalcified pulmonary micronodules.
14-mm lesion in the left kidney, likely representing a hemorrhagic or proteinaceous cyst; several additional renal and hepatic cysts with no concerning features.

laboratory_examinations.date: First biopsy: Not specified, Repeat biopsy: Not specified
laboratory_examinations.findings: First biopsy showed urticarial tissue reaction with focal leukocytoclastic changes and negative direct immunofluorescence; repeat punch biopsy showed nonspecific findings of perivascular lymphocytic infiltrates with a few scattered eosinophils, mast cells, and neutrophils.
